intro: Juncus biluoshanensis, commonly known as the Biluoshan rush, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Juncaginaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, cylindrical leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
